result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawn Edward Morris

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Shawn Edward Morris in court.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer in court for Shawn Edward Morris.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
MATTER HEARD OFF THE RECORD. Defense counsel requests a plea and sentencing hearing. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-10-2022
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Status Report - 10-07-2022

Defendant Shawn Edward Morris not in court, in custody.  Attorney Matthew V Plummer appeared by video for Shawn Edward Morris.  Prosecuting attorney Tristan J. Bednarek in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Bail/bond hearing held. Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Defense counsel needs discovery and an offer from the State and requests a scheduling conference.  Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KMG (10/21/01).Court advised Defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shawn Edward Morris appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey appeared by video for Shawn Edward Morris.  Prosecuting attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is advised that due to a lower pending matter, this case has been re-assigned to Judge Kiefer, Branch 29. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant pled not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact order signed and filed.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
